text.0: him who with might hath propped earths ends who sitteth in threefold seat bṛhaspati with thunder.
text.1: him of the pleasant tongue have ancient sages deepthinking holy singers set before them.
text.2: wild in their course in wellmarked wise rejoicing were they bṛhaspati who pressed around us.
text.3: preserve bṛhaspati the stall uninjured this companys raining evermoving birthplace.
text.4: bṛhaspati from thy remotest distance have they sat down who love the law eternal.
text.5: for thee were dug wells springing from the mountain which murmuring round about pour streams of sweetness.
text.6: bṛhaspati when first he had his being from mighty splendour in supremest heaven.
text.7: strong with his sevenfold mouth with noise of thunder with his seven rays blew and dispersed the darkness.
text.8: with the loudshouting band who sang his praises with thunder he destroyed obstructive vala.
text.9: bṛhaspati thundering drave forth the cattle the lowing cows who make oblations ready.
text.10: serve we with sacrifices gifts and homage even thus the steer of all the gods the father.
text.11: bṛhaspati may we be lords of riches with noble progeny and store of heroes.
text.12: surely that king by power and might heroic hath made him lord of all his foes possesions.
text.13: who cherishes bṛhaspati welltended adorns and worships him as foremost sharer.
text.14: in his own house he dwells in peace and comfort to him for ever holy food flows richly.
text.15: to him the people with free will pay homagethe king with whom the brahman hath precedence.
text.16: he unopposed is master of the riches of his own subjects and of hostile people.
text.17: the gods uphold that king with their protection who helps the brahman when he seeks his favour.
text.18: indra bṛhaspati rainers of treasure rejoicing at this sacrifice drink the soma.
text.19: let the abundant drops sink deep within you vouchsafe us riches with full store of heroes.
text.20: bṛhaspati and indra make us prosper may this be your benevolence to usward.
text.21: assist our holy thoughts wake up our spirit weaken the hatred of our foe and rivals.
